China's Zheng books maiden Grand Slam final spot at Australian OpenChina's Zheng Qinwen ended the fairytale run of qualifier Dayana Yastremska at the Australian Open with a 6-4 6-4 victory on Thursday to reach her first Grand Slam final, where she will face defending champion Aryna Sabalenka. Thu, 25 Jan 2024 12:51:57 GMT UAFGXMEYIVO2NKDQ5RYI3VGWNE https://www.reuters.com/sports/tennis/chinas-zheng-books-maiden-grand-slam-final-berth-australian-open-2024-01-25/Sonali Paul运动的网球
Bishop approved by pope ordained in China in apparent thaw in relationsA bishop appointed by Pope Francis was installed in a diocese in China on Thursday, the Vatican said, in an apparent thaw in relations following friction when government-backed bishops were named without papal permission. Thu, 25 Jan 2024 12:50:19 GMT TH4OCWLUEBIBPGNLDKG5FPTENI https://www.reuters.com/world/bishop-approved-by-pope-ordained-china-apparent-thaw-relations-2024-01-25/Philip Pullella世界
Gauff hurting but proud of teen achievement after Melbourne semi lossCoco Gauff will take plenty of positives out of her last Grand Slam campaign as a teenager once the pain of her loss to Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling Australian Open semi-final fades. Europe will miss 2030 chip market goal, says ASML CEOEurope will miss its goal of raising its share of the global computer chip market to 20% by 2030 because it is not building manufacturing capacity fast enough, semiconductor equipment maker ASML CEO Peter Wennink said. Thu, 25 Jan 2024 11:50:36 GMT MGK7BZUQNNJE5GQHIVDTHLKANM https://www.reuters.com/technology/europe-will-miss-2030-chip-market-goal-says-asml-ceo-2024-01-25/Toby Sterling技术
ASIA RICE India rates spring to record highs on dwindling supplies, firm demandRates of parboiled rice exported from top hub India advanced to record highs this week on limited supplies and steady demand from Asian and African buyers, while prices eased in Vietnam and Thailand. Philippines, Vietnam to sign coastguard deal risking China's ireThe Philippines and Vietnam will agree to boost coastguard cooperation during a visit to Hanoi next week by Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr, officials said, a move that risks angering China. Hillhouse vying for Everstone's $1 bln Asia health services firm Everlife - sourcesGlobal investment firm Hillhouse is emerging as one of the final few bidders for Everlife Holdings in a deal that could value the Asian healthcare services company at up to $1 billion, two people with knowledge of the matter said. China slams US 'provocation' in Taiwan Strait, pledges further drillsChina criticised the United States on Thursday for causing "trouble and provocation" after the U.S. Navy sailed its first warship through the sensitive Taiwan Strait since presidential and parliamentary elections on the island. China says Boeing has permission to resume 737 MAX 8 deliveriesChina said on Thursday it gave Boeing permission last month to resume deliveries of its 737 MAX 8 to local customers, ending an import freeze on the U.S. planemaker's most profitable jets which came shortly after its first delivery in 2019. India's Jindal Stainless cuts export forecast on Red Sea crisis, weaker EU, US demandIndia's Jindal Stainless Ltd has cut its exports forecast for the fiscal year ending March due to freight disruptions in the Red Sea and faltering demand in Europe and the United States, a top executive said.
